intro: Amsinckia cana, commonly known as the desert larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Amsinckia cana is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a food source for certain pollinators.
